name: Ext_R4B_MedicinalProductDefinition
title: Cross-version Extension for R4B.MedicinalProductDefinition for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Detailed definition of a medicinal product
element.definition: A medicinal product, being a substance or combination of substances that is intended to treat, prevent or diagnose a disease, or to restore, correct or modify physiological functions by exerting a pharmacological, immunological or metabolic action. This resource is intended to define and detail such products and their properties, for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, or drug catalogs).

element.short: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

binding.description: Overall defining type of this medicinal product.

element.short: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.domain from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.domain from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

binding.description: Applicable domain for this product (e.g. human, veterinary).

element.short: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product
element.definition: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

element.short: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product
element.definition: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

element.short: The status within the lifecycle of this product record
element.definition: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

element.short: The status within the lifecycle of this product record
element.definition: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: The date at which the given status became applicable
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.statusDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date at which the given status became applicable
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.statusDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General description of this product
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General description of this product
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product
element.definition: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

element.short: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product
element.definition: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

binding.description: Dose forms for a product as a whole, considering all individual parts, but before any mixing

element.short: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body
element.definition: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

element.short: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body
element.definition: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

binding.description: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a patient's body.

element.short: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required
element.definition: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

element.short: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required
element.definition: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

element.short: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.legalStatusOfSupply from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.legalStatusOfSupply from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

binding.description: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

element.short: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons, such as heightened reporting requirements.

element.short: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons, such as heightened reporting requirements.

binding.description: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as heightened reporting requirements (e.g. Black Triangle Monitoring).

element.short: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

element.short: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

binding.description: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

element.short: If authorised for use in children
element.definition: If authorised for use in children, or infants, neonates etc.

element.short: If authorised for use in children
element.definition: If authorised for use in children, or infants, neonates etc.

binding.description: Suitability for age groups, in particular children.

element.short: Allows the product to be classified by various systems
element.definition: Allows the product to be classified by various systems, commonly WHO ATC.

element.short: Allows the product to be classified by various systems
element.definition: Allows the product to be classified by various systems, commonly WHO ATC.

binding.description: This value set includes codes from the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System - provided as an exemplar value set.

element.short: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization
element.definition: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization. This refers to the product being actually 'on the market' as opposed to being allowed to be on the market (which is an authorization).

element.short: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 ‑ 1 alpha-2 code elements
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.country from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 ‑ 1 alpha-2 code elements
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.country from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.jurisdiction from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.jurisdiction from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.status from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.status from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.dateRange from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.dateRange from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.restoreDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MarketingStatus.restoreDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Data type name for MedicinalProductDefinition.marketingStatus from FHIR R4B
element.definition: Data type name for MedicinalProductDefinition.marketingStatus from FHIR R4B

element.short: Package type for the product
element.definition: Package type for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

element.short: Package type for the product
element.definition: Package type for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

binding.description: Types of medicinal product packs

element.short: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources
element.definition: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

element.short: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources
element.definition: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

binding.description: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

element.short: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product
element.definition: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Data type name for MedicinalProductDefinition.impurity from FHIR R4B
element.definition: Data type name for MedicinalProductDefinition.impurity from FHIR R4B

element.short: Additional documentation about the medicinal product
element.definition: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

element.short: Additional documentation about the medicinal product
element.definition: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

element.short: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)
element.definition: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

element.short: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)
element.definition: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

element.short: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.contact from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents MedicinalProductDefinition.contact.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicinalProductDefinition|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: A manufacturing or administrative process for the medicinal product
element.definition: A manufacturing or administrative process or step associated with (or performed on) the medicinal product.

element.short: The type of manufacturing operation e.g. manufacturing itself, re-packaging
element.definition: The type of manufacturing operation e.g. manufacturing itself, re-packaging. For the authorization of this, a RegulatedAuthorization would point to the same plan or activity referenced here.
